requirement_tested: Frontend application with dynamic data fetching from backend APIs
user_persona: A project manager named Sarah who needs real-time updates on her construction projects.
user_goal: To view the latest project data without seeing any outdated or mock information.

narrative_steps.title: Accessing the Dashboard
narrative_steps.description: Sarah logs into the system and lands on the dashboard, expecting to see live project data fetched from the backend.
narrative_steps.action: Navigate to the dashboard after logging in.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The dashboard displays project cards populated with real-time data fetched from backend APIs, not hardcoded values.

narrative_steps.title: Checking Project Details
narrative_steps.description: Sarah clicks on a project card to see more detailed information, relying on dynamic data loading.
narrative_steps.action: Click on a project card to view its details.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Project details load dynamically via an API call, showing up-to-date information about the selected project.

requirement_tested: Backend application connecting to PostgreSQL database using specified environment variables
user_persona: A developer named Alex responsible for deploying the application.
user_goal: To ensure the backend service connects to the correct PostgreSQL database using predefined environment variables.

narrative_steps.title: Setting Environment Variables
narrative_steps.description: Alex sets the required environment variables for database connectivity before starting the backend server.
narrative_steps.action: Set DB_HOST=localhost, DB_PORT=5432, DB_USERNAME=myappuser, DB_PASSWORD=myapppassword, DB_NAME=myapp in the environment.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Environment variables are correctly set and recognized by the application runtime.

narrative_steps.title: Starting Backend Service
narrative_steps.description: Alex starts the backend service, which should now connect to the PostgreSQL database using the configured environment variables.
narrative_steps.action: Run `npm run dev` from the root directory to start the backend service.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The backend successfully establishes a connection to the PostgreSQL database using the specified environment variables without errors.

user_persona: A new team member, Jordan, joining a construction firm and accessing the management portal for the first time.
user_goal: To register, log in securely, and gain access to authorized features based on their role.

narrative_steps.title: Registering Account
narrative_steps.description: Jordan visits the site and registers for a new account by filling out the registration form.
narrative_steps.action: Fill out the registration form with username, email, password, and submit.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Account is created successfully, and Jordan receives confirmation of successful registration.

narrative_steps.title: Logging In
narrative_steps.description: After receiving confirmation, Jordan proceeds to log in using the newly created credentials.
narrative_steps.action: Enter registered email and password, then click the login button.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Upon successful authentication, Jordan is redirected to the dashboard and a JWT token is stored locally.

user_persona: Taylor, a senior project manager overseeing multiple construction sites.
user_goal: To create a new project and manage its lifecycle from initiation to completion.

narrative_steps.title: Creating a New Project
narrative_steps.description: Taylor navigates to the project management section and initiates the creation of a new project.
narrative_steps.action: Click the 'Add New Project' button and fill in the project details in the modal form.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A new project is created and appears in the project list with the provided details and initial status.

narrative_steps.title: Updating Project Status
narrative_steps.description: As the project progresses, Taylor updates its status to reflect current progress.
narrative_steps.action: Click the edit icon next to the project and change its status to 'In Progress'.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The project's status is updated in the database and immediately reflected in the project list.

requirement_tested: Document management system with upload, storage, and retrieval capabilities
user_persona: Casey, a site supervisor who regularly uploads inspection reports and blueprints.
user_goal: To upload important project documents and retrieve them when needed for review or sharing.

narrative_steps.title: Uploading Documents
narrative_steps.description: While reviewing project files, Casey notices missing inspection reports and decides to upload them.
narrative_steps.action: Click the 'Upload' button in the document management panel and select files to upload.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Selected files are uploaded successfully and appear in the document list with metadata such as filename and upload date.

narrative_steps.title: Downloading Documents
narrative_steps.description: Later, Casey needs to share a blueprint with a colleague and downloads it from the system.
narrative_steps.action: Locate the blueprint in the document list and click the 'Download' button.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The file is downloaded to Caseyâ€™s device, ready for sharing.

requirement_tested: Project scheduling and timeline management tool
user_persona: Morgan, a scheduler coordinating complex construction timelines.
user_goal: To visualize and adjust project timelines using an interactive Gantt chart.

narrative_steps.title: Viewing Project Timeline
narrative_steps.description: Morgan opens the scheduling tool to review the current project timeline represented in a Gantt chart.
narrative_steps.action: Navigate to the project's timeline tab.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A Gantt chart loads displaying all tasks aligned along the date axis with accurate durations and dependencies.

narrative_steps.title: Adjusting Task Dates
narrative_steps.description: Noticing a delay, Morgan adjusts a task's start and end dates by dragging the task bar.
narrative_steps.action: Drag a task bar horizontally to reschedule its timeframe.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The task's dates update visually and are synchronized with the backend upon releasing the drag.

requirement_tested: Team communication platform with messaging features
user_persona: Riley, a foreman coordinating with various teams on-site.
user_goal: To send quick updates and receive responses from team members through integrated messaging.

narrative_steps.title: Sending a Message
narrative_steps.description: During a critical phase, Riley quickly sends a safety reminder to the crew via the messaging interface.
narrative_steps.action: Type the message in the compose area and press Enter to send.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The message is posted to the backend and instantly appears in the chat history for all relevant team members.

narrative_steps.title: Receiving Confirmation
narrative_steps.description: Riley waits for acknowledgment from the team to confirm receipt of the message.
narrative_steps.action: Observe incoming replies in the message history pane.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Team members' acknowledgments appear in real-time, confirming the message was received and understood.

requirement_tested: Job costing estimation module with calculation capabilities
user_persona: Quinn, a financial analyst preparing budget forecasts for upcoming projects.
user_goal: To calculate and save accurate job cost estimates for proposal submissions.

narrative_steps.title: Entering Cost Data
narrative_steps.description: Quinn accesses the estimator module to input projected costs for materials, labor, and equipment.
narrative_steps.action: Fill in numeric values under the Materials, Labor, and Equipment tabs.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: As values are entered, the total estimate updates in real-time to reflect the sum of all categories.

narrative_steps.title: Saving the Estimate
narrative_steps.description: Satisfied with the calculated figures, Quinn saves the estimate for future reference and reporting.
narrative_steps.action: Click the 'Save Estimate' button.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The estimate is persisted to the backend database and can be retrieved later for comparison or invoicing.

requirement_tested: Time tracking system for monitoring project progress
user_persona: Peyton, a worker required to log hours spent on different project tasks.
user_goal: To accurately record time worked on specific tasks for payroll and project analysis purposes.

narrative_steps.title: Starting Time Tracking
narrative_steps.description: At the beginning of the day, Peyton starts a timer for a designated task to automatically log hours.
narrative_steps.action: Select a task and click the 'Start Timer' button.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A timer begins counting elapsed time for the selected task, visible to Peyton during work.

narrative_steps.title: Stopping and Logging Time
narrative_steps.description: Once finished with the task, Peyton stops the timer to finalize the logged hours.
narrative_steps.action: Click the 'Stop Timer' button after completing the task.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Accumulated time is logged against the task and saved to the backend for inclusion in weekly summaries.

requirement_tested: Resource management dashboard for allocation and monitoring
user_persona: Ava, a logistics coordinator allocating personnel and equipment across several active projects.
user_goal: To efficiently allocate available resources and monitor their usage to avoid conflicts.

narrative_steps.title: Allocating Resources
narrative_steps.description: Ava reviews the resource dashboard to assign a piece of machinery to a project requiring immediate attention.
narrative_steps.action: Select the equipment and click the 'Allocate' button, choosing the target project.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The equipment is marked as allocated to the chosen project, updating availability indicators accordingly.

narrative_steps.title: Monitoring Usage
narrative_steps.description: Throughout the week, Ava checks how resources are being utilized across projects.
narrative_steps.action: Use filter dropdowns to narrow down the view to specific resource types.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Dashboard widgets update to show only the selected resource category, helping Ava make informed decisions.

requirement_tested: Light gray background color scheme across all pages
user_persona: An office administrator named Lee who uses the system daily for administrative tasks.
user_goal: To navigate a visually consistent interface that reduces eye strain during prolonged use.

narrative_steps.title: Loading the Homepage
narrative_steps.description: Lee opens the browser and goes to the homepage, expecting a familiar and comfortable layout.
narrative_steps.action: Visit the homepage URL in the browser.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The entire page background renders uniformly in light gray (#f0f0f0) across all sections.

narrative_steps.title: Navigating to Different Sections
narrative_steps.description: Lee moves between various sections of the application, maintaining visual continuity.
narrative_steps.action: Click on navigation links to switch between dashboard, projects, and settings pages.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Each visited page maintains the consistent light gray background, providing a seamless experience.

requirement_tested: Dark red UI elements including buttons, headers, and navigation
user_persona: Zoe, a frequent user accustomed to the platform's distinctive branding.
user_goal: To interact with clearly identifiable UI controls that align with company branding.

narrative_steps.title: Identifying Primary Actions
narrative_steps.description: Zoe looks for the main action buttons on the dashboard to begin her workflow.
narrative_steps.action: Scan the dashboard for prominent call-to-action buttons.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: All primary buttons, such as 'Add New Project', are styled with a dark red background (#8B0000) and white text.

narrative_steps.title: Interacting with Navigation
narrative_steps.description: Zoe uses the top navigation bar to move between major sections of the application.
narrative_steps.action: Hover over and click on navigation menu items in the header.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Navigation headers maintain a dark red theme, with hover effects subtly darkening the shade for feedback.

requirement_tested: Responsive design compatible with desktop and mobile devices
user_persona: Noah, a field inspector who accesses the system remotely using a smartphone.
user_goal: To perform essential functions like checking schedules and uploading photos while on-site.

narrative_steps.title: Accessing Mobile View
narrative_steps.description: On arrival at the site, Noah opens the app on his phone to check today's schedule.
narrative_steps.action: Open the website on a mobile device or resize the browser window to simulate mobile resolution.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Layout adapts to a single-column stack suitable for touch interaction, with appropriately scaled fonts and expanded touch targets.

narrative_steps.title: Using Touch Gestures
narrative_steps.description: Noah scrolls through long lists and interacts with elements designed for finger tapping.
narrative_steps.action: Scroll through project lists and tap on actionable items like document download buttons.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Lists respond smoothly to scrolling, and taps register accurately without misfires due to poor spacing.

requirement_tested: Package.json configured with 'install:all' script for frontend and backend installation
user_persona: A DevOps engineer named Riley setting up a new development environment.
user_goal: To streamline dependency installation for both frontend and backend with a single command.

narrative_steps.title: Cloning Repository
narrative_steps.description: Riley clones the project repository to begin setting up the local development environment.
narrative_steps.action: Clone the repository to a local machine.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Repository is cloned successfully, containing separate directories for client and server code.

narrative_steps.title: Installing Dependencies
narrative_steps.description: Rather than installing packages separately, Riley uses the unified install script.
narrative_steps.action: Run `npm run install:all` from the root directory.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Both frontend and backend dependencies are installed concurrently without manual intervention.

requirement_tested: Package.json configured with 'dev' script to run frontend and backend concurrently
user_persona: Ellis, a full-stack developer working on feature implementation.
user_goal: To launch both frontend and backend development servers simultaneously for efficient coding.

narrative_steps.title: Preparing Development Session
narrative_steps.description: Before beginning work, Ellis prepares the development environment by launching both services.
narrative_steps.action: Execute `npm run dev` from the root directory.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Frontend development server and backend nodemon watcher start concurrently in the same terminal session.

narrative_steps.title: Confirming Services Are Running
narrative_steps.description: Ellis verifies that both applications are running and communicating properly.
narrative_steps.action: Check terminal output and attempt to access the frontend in the browser.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Terminal shows both servers are active, and the frontend loads successfully, making API calls to the backend.
